intro: Pterygodium vermiferum, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a climbing shrub that produces small, white or yellowish flowers and small, round fruits. The plant is characterized by its pinnate leaves and distinctive stipules that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant has been traditionally used for its purported medicinal properties, including treating respiratory and digestive ailments.
